Most class passengers are avoiding the smelly press of the doc using an elevated boarding bridge, twenty feet above. They pass a line of steerage passengers in their coarse w queued up inside movable barriers like cattle in a chute. examines their heads one by one, checking scalp and eyela They pass a well-dressed young man cranking the handle of "cinematograph" camera mounted on a tripod. NANIEL MARVIN founded the Biograph Film Studio) is filming his young br the Titanic. MARY MARVIN stands stiffly and smiles, self

Mary Marvin, without an acting fiber in her body, does a pantomime of awe, hands raised. Cal is jostled by two yelling steerage boys who shove pas bumped again a second later by the boys' father.

dialogues.text: Steady!!

They burst out onto the pier and Jack c stop... staring at the cast wall of the ship's hull, towe above the wharf and over an eighth of a mile long. The Ti monstrous. Fabrizio runs back and grabs Jack, and they sprint toward gangway aft, at E deck. They reach the bottom of the ramp OFFICER MOODY detaches it at the top. It starts to swing gangway doors.

With conte c rapidly, using sure strokes. An emigrant from Manchester his 3 year old daughter CORA standing on the lower rung o leaned back against his beer barrel of a stomach, watchin THE SKETCH captures them perfectly, with a great sense of the moment. Jack is good. Really good. Fabrizio looks ove He nods appreciatively. TOMMY RYAN, a scowling young Irish emigrant, watches as a by, walking three small dogs around the deck. One of them BULLDOG, is among the ugliest creatures on the planet.

They a each other, about 60 feet apart, with the well deck like them. She on her promontory, he on his much lower one. Sh the water. He watches her unpin her elaborate hat and take it off. S frilly absurd thing, then tosses it over the rail. It sai water and is carried away, astern. A spot of yellow in th is riveted by her. She looks like a figure in a romantic isolated. Fabrizio taps Tommy and they both look at Jack gazin at R Tommy grin at each other. Rose turns suddenly and looks right at Jack. He is caught doesn't look away. She does, but then looks back. Their e the space of the well deck, across the gulf between world Jack sees a man (Cal) come up behind her and take her arm arm away. They argue in pantomime. She storms away, and h disappearing along the A-deck promenade. Jack stares afte

dialogues.text: Forget it, boyo. You'd as like have angels fly out o' yer to the likes o' her.

She fling the dresser and it flies clattering against the wall. She handmirror against the vanity, cracking it.

She in the shadows, and runs right past him. TRACKING WITH ROSE as she runs across the deserted fantai hitches in an occasional sob, which she suppresses. Rose base of the stern flagpole and clings there, panting. She black water. Then starts to climb over the railing. She has to hitch h up, and climbing is clumsy. Moving methodically she turns her heels on the white-painted gunwale, her back to the r toward blackness. 60 feet below her, the massive propelle the atlantin into white foam, and a ghostly wake trails o horizon. IN A LOW ANGLE, we see Rose standing like a figurehead in her are the huge letters of the name "TITANIC". She leans out, her arms straightening... looking down hyp vortex below her. Her dress and hair are lifted by the wi movement. The only sound, above the rush of water below, snap of the big Union Jack right above her.

Fabrizio is running toward hi something in Italian. Tommy and Fabrizio start pounding o everybody up and out. The alarm spreads in several langua

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of people have come out into the corridor in rob STeWARD hurries along, reassuring them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have the engines stopped? I felt a shudder? STEWARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't worry, m'am. We've likely thrown a propeller shudder you felt. May I bring you anything? THOMAS ANDREWS brushes past them, walking fast and carryi rolled up ship's plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Rose are leaning over the starboard rail, lookin the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks okay. I don't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it have damaged the ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't seem like much of a bump. I'm sure we're okay. Behind them a couple of steerage guys are kicking the ice laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabrizio and Tommy are in a crowd of steerage men cloggin heading aft away from the flooding. Many of them have gra duffel bags, some of which are soaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is the direction the rats were runnin', it's good

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce Ismay, dressed in pajamas under the topcoat, hurrie corridor, headed for the bridge. An officious steward nam along the other direction, getting the few concerned pass their rooms. STEWARD BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no cause for alarm. Please, go back to your rooms He is stopped in his tracks by Cal and Lovejoy. STEWARD BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, sir. There's no emergency--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes there is, I have been robbed. Now get the Master at A moron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. CAPTAIN SMITH studying the commutator. He turns to Andrews, standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A five degree list in less than ten minutes. SHIP'S CARPENTER JOHN HUTCHINSON enters behind him, out o clearly unnerved. HUTCHINSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's making water fast... in the forepeak tank and the f boiler room six. ISMAY enters, his movements quick with anger and frustrat at him with annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have we stopped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've struck ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do you think the ship is seriously damaged?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glaring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Smith pushes past him, with Andrews and Hutchinson in tow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strokers and firemen are struggling to draw the fires. Th waist deep water churning around as it flows into the boi and swirling with grease from the machinery. Chief Engine partway down the ladder and shouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, lads. Get the hell up! They scramble up the escape ladders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gentlemen, now joined by another man, leans on the fo watching the steerage men playing soccer with chunks of i GENTLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it's nothing too serious. I'm going back to my ca A 20ish YALE MAN pops through the door wearing a topcoat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, did I miss the fun? Rose and Jack come up the steps from the well deck, which the three men. They stare as the couple climbs over the l A moment later Captain Smith rounds the corner, followed Carpenter Hutchinson. They have come down from the bridge stairs. The three men, their faces grim, crush right past Andrews barely glances at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you shore up? HUTCHINSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless the pumps get ahead. The inspection party goes down the stairs to the well dec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to tell Mother and Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me, Jack. I jump, you jump... Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Jack follows Rose through the door inside the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Rose cross the foyer, entering the corridor. Lov for them in the hall as they approach the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been looking for you miss. Lovejoy follows and, unseen, moves close behind Jack and diamond necklace into the pocket of his overcoat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal and Ruth wait in the sitting room, along with the Mas two stewards (Steward #1 and Barnes). Silence as Rose and closes her robe at her throat when she sees Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something serious has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Two things dear to me have disappeared this one is back... (he looks from Rose to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I have a pretty good idea where to fine the other. (to Master at Arms)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search him. The Master at Arms steps up to Jack. MASTER AT ARMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coat off, mate. Lovejoy pulls at Jack's coat and Jack shakes his head in out of it. The Master at Arms pats him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is horseshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal, you can't be serious! We're in the middle of an emer Steward Barnes pulls the Heart of the Ocean out of the po coat. STEWARD BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this it? Rose is stunned. Needless to say, so is Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. MASTER AT ARMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right then. Now don't make a fuss. He starts to handcuff Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you believe it, Rose. Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncertain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he could. Easy enough for a professional. He me combination when you opend the safe. FLASHBACK: Rose at the safe, looking in the mirror and me as he stands behind her, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I was with him the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just to her, low and cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he did it while you were putting your clothes back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They put it in my pocket!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding Jack's coat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not even your pocket, son. (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Property of A. L. Ryerson". Lovejoy shows the coat to the Master at Arms. There is a collar with the owner's name. MASTER AT ARMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was reported stolen today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to return it! Rose-- Rose feels utterly betrayed, hurt and confused. She shrin He starts shouting to her as Lovejoy and the Master at Ar into the hall. She can't look him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose, don't listen to them... I didn't do this! You know it! She is devastated. Her mother lays a comforting hand on h tears well up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do women believe men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith and Andrews come down the steps to the Mail Sorting the clerks scrambling to pull mail from the racks. They a hauling wet sacks of mail up from the hold below. Andrews climbs partway down the stairs to the hold, which Sacks of mail float everywhere. The lights are still on b casting an eerie glow. The Renault is visible under the w glinting cheerfully. Andrews looks down as the water cove scrambles back up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrews unrolls a big drawing of the ship across the char a side elevation, showing all the watertight bulkheads. H shaking. Murdoch and Ismay hover behind Andrews and the C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can we get underway, do you think? Smith glares at him and turns his attention to Andrews' d builder points to it for emphasis as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water 14 feet above the keel in ten minutes... in the for three holds... and in boiler room six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five compartments. She can stay afloat with the first fou breached. But not five. Not five. As she goes down by the will spill over the tops of the bulkheads... at E Deck... next... back and back. There's no stopping it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pumps--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pumps buy you time... but minutes only. From this mom what we do, Titanic will founder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this ship can't sink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is made of iron, sir. I assure you, she can. And she mathematical certainty. Smith looks like he has been gutpunched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour, two at most. Ismay reels as his dream turns into his worst nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how many aboard, Mr. Murdoch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two thousand two hundred souls aboard, sir. A long beat. Smith turns to his employer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you may get your headlines, Mr. Ismay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrews is striding along the boat deck, as seamen and of uncover the boats. Steam is venting from pipes on the fun the din is horrendous. Speech is difficult adding to the disorganization. Andrews sees some men fumbling with the of the Wellin davits and yells to them over the roar of s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn to the right! Pull the falls taut before you unchock had a boat drill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir! Not with these new davits, sir. He looks around, disguisted as the crew fumble with the d tackle for the "falls"... the ropes which are used to low few passengers are coming out on deck, hesitantly in the cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside the sitting room they can hear knocking and v corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had better go dress. Ruth exits and Hockley crosses to Rose. He regards her co then SLAPS her across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a little slut, isn't it? To Rose the blow is inconsequential compared to the blow given. Cal grabs her shoulders roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, you little-- There is a loud knock on the door and an urgent voice. Th their steward puts his head in. STEWARD BARNES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I've been told to ask you to please put on your life to the boat deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. We're busy. The steward persists, coming in to get the lifebelts down dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about the inconvenience, Mr. Hockley, but it's Please dress warmly, it's quite cold tonight. (he hands a lifebelt to Rose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to worry, miss, I'm sure it's just a precaution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. In the corridor outside the stewards are being so polite they are conveying no sense of danger whatsoever. However story in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACKNESS. Then BANG! The door is thrown open and the lig a steward. The Cartmell family rouses from a sound sleep. STEWARD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody up. Let's go. Put your lifebelts on. IN THE CORRIDOR outside, another steward is going from do the hall, pouncing and yelling. STEWARD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lifebelts on. Lifebelts on. Everybody up, come on. Lifebe People come out of the doors behind the steward, perplexe foreground a SYRIAN WOMAN asks her husband what was said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON PHILLIPS, looking shocked. PHILLIPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CQD, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. The distress call. CQD. Tell whoever respon going down by the head and need immediate assistance. Smith hurries out. PHILLIPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blimey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you ought to try that new distress call... S.O.S. (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may be our only chance to use it. Phillips laughs in spite of himself and starts sending hi S.O.S. Dit dit dit, da da da, dit dit dit... over and ove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas Andrews looks around in amazement. The deck is emp crew fumbling with the davits. He yells over the roar of Officer Murdoch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are all the passengers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've all gone back inside. Too damn cold and noisy for Andrews feels like he is in a bad dream. He looks at his heads for the foyer entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large number of First Class passengers have gathered ne They are getting indignant about the confusion. Molly Bro YOUNG STEWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's doing, sonny? You've got us all trussed up and now heels. The young steward backs away, actually stumbling on the s YOUNG STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, mum. Let me go and find out. The jumpy piano rhythm of "Alexander's Ragtime Band" come class lounge a few yards away. Band leader WALLACE HARTLE some of his men on Captain's orders, to allay panic. Hockley's entourage comes up to the A-deck foyer. Cal is lifebelts, almost as an afterthought. Rose is like a slee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the God damned English doing everything by the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no need for language, Mr. Hockley. (to Trudy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back and turn the heater on in my room, so it won't be get back. Thomas Andrews enters, looking around the magnificent roo is doomed. Rose, standing nearby, sees his heartbroken ex walks over to him and Cal goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the iceberg, Mr. Andrews. And I see it in your eyes the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship will sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're certain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. In an hour or so... all this... will be at the botto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. Now it is Cal's turn to look stunned. The Titanic? Sinkin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell only who you must, I don't want to be respons And get to a boat quickly. Don't wait. You remember what the boats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I understand. Thankyou. Andrews goes off, moving among the passengers and urging their lifebelts and get to the boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovejoy and the Master at Arms are handcuffing Jack to a crewman rushes in anxiously and almost blurts to the Mast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wanted by the Purser, sir. Urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. I'll keep an eye on him. Lovejoy pulls a pearl handled Colt .45 automatic from und Master at Arms nods and tosses the handcuff key to Lovejo the crewman. Lovejoy flips the key in the air. Catches it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior Wireless Operator Bride is relaying a message to C the CUNARD LINER CARPATHIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carpathia says they're making 17 knots, full steam for th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's the only one who's responding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only one close, sir. She says they can be here in fou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hours! The enormity of it hits Smith like a sledgehammer blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Bride. He turns as Bride exits, and looks out onto the blackness

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightoller has his boats swung out. He is standing amidst uncertain passengers in all states of dress and undress. woman is barefoot. Others are in stockings. The maitre of in top hat and overcoat. Others are still in evening dres in bathrobes and kimonos. Women are wearing lifebelts ove then topping it with sble stoles. Some brought jewels, ot small dogs. Lightoller sees Smith walking stiffly toward him and quic He yells into the Captain's ear, through cupped hands, ov steam... LIGHTOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hadn't we better get the women and children into the boat Smith just nods, a bit abstractly. The fire has gone out sees the awesome truth in Smith's face. LIGHTOLLER (to the men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right! Start the loading. Women and children! The appalling din of escaping steam abruptly cuts off, le unearthly silence in which Lightoller's voice echoes. ON WALLACE HARTLEY raising his violin to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number 26. Ready and-- The band has reassembled just outside the First Class Ent near where Lightoller is calling for the boats to be load a waltz, lively and elegant. The music wafts all over the LIGHTOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies, please. Step into the boat. Finally one soman steps across the gap, into the boat, te drop to the water far below. WOMAN IN CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch. They'll put us off in these silly little boats we'll all be back on board by breakfast. Cal, Rose and Ruth come out of the doors near the band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brooch, I left my brooch. I must have it! She turns back to go to her room but Cal takes her by the let her go. The firmness of his hold surprises her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here, Ruth. Ruth sees his expression, and knows fear for the first ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is chaos, with stewards pushing their way through narr clogged with peopel carrying suitcases, duffel bags, chil lifebelts on, others don't. STEWARD #2 (to Steward #3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told the stupid sods no luggage. Aw, bloody hell! He throws up his hand at the sight of a family, loaded do bags, completely blocking the corridor. Fabrizio and Tommy push past the stewards, going the othe huge crowd gathered at the bottom of the MAIN 3RD CLASS S spots Helga with the rest of the Dahl family, standing pa suitcases in hand. He reaches her and she grins, hugging Tommy pushes to where he can see what's holding up the gr steel gate across the top of the stairs, with several ste on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay calm, please. It's not time to go up to the boats ye Near Tommy, an IRISHWOMAN stands stoically with two small their battered luggage. LITTLE BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing, mummy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just waiting, dear. When they fiish putting First C boats, they'll be startin' with us, and we'll want to be we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boat 7 is less than half full, with 28 aboard a boat made FIRST OFFICER MURDOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower away! By the left and right together, stady lads! The boat lurches as the falls start to pay out through th The women gasp. The boat descends, swaying and jerking, t feet below. The passengers are terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING along the rows of portholes angling down into th surface, they glow green. PUSHING IN on one porthole whic submerged. Inside we see Jack, looking apprehensively at up the glass. INSIDE THE MASTER AT ARMS' OFFICE Jack sits chained to th to the porthole. Lovejoy sits on the edge of a desk. He p on the desk and watches it roll across and fall off. He p bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... I believe this ship may sink. (crosses to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been asked to give you this small token of our appre He punches Jack hard in the stomach, knocking the wind ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compliments of Mr. Caledon Hockley. Lovejoy flips the handcuff key in the air, catches it and pocket. He exits. Jack is left gasping, handcuffed to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the stairwell rail on the bridge wing, Fourth Officer Quartermaster Rowe light the first distress rocket. It sh and EXPLODES with a thunderclap over the ship, sending ou which light up the entire deck as they fall. WHIP PAN off the starbursts to Ismay. The Managing Direct Line is cracking. Already at the breaking point from his rocket panics him. He starts shouting at the officers str falls of BOAT 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no time to waste! (yelling and waving his arms)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower away! Lower away! Lower away! FIFTH OFFICER LOWE, a baby-faced 28, and the youngest off from the tangled falls at the madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the way, you fool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who I am? Lowe, not having a clue nor caring, squares up to Ismay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a passenger. And I'm a ship's bloody officer. Now told!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOWE (CONT'D) (turning away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady men! Stand by the falls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (numbly, backing away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, quite right. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECOND OFFICER LIGHTOLLER is loading the boat nearest Cal 6. LIGHTOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women and children only! Sorry sir, no men yet. Another rocket bursts overhead, lighting the crowd. Start upward. Fear now in the eyes. DANIEL MARVIN has his Biograph camera set up, cranking aw get an exposure off the rocket's light. he has Mary posed scene at the boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're afraid, darling. Scared to death. That's it! Either she suddenly learned to act or she is petrified. ROSE watches the farewells taking pace right in front of closer to the boat. Husbands saying goodbye to wives and and friends parted. Nearby MOLLY is getting a reluctant w boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you heard the man. Get in the boat, sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will the lifeboats be seated according to class? I hope t crowded--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mother shut up! (Ruth freezes, mouth open)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you understand? The water is freezing and there are boats... not enough by half. Half the people on this ship

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the better half. PUSH IN ON ROSE'S FACE as it hits her like a thunderbolt. class. He doesn't stand a chance. Another rocket bursts o her face in white light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You unimaginable bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Ruth, get in the boat. These are the first class here. That's it. Molly practically hands her over to Lightoller, then look other women who might need a push.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Rose. You're next, darlin'. Rose steps back, shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose, get in the boat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, mother. Ruth, standing in the tippy lifeboat, can do nothing. Cal but she pulls free and walks away through the crowd. Cal and grabs her again, roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? To him? Is that it? To be a whore to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather be his whore than your wife. He clenches his jaw and squeezes her arm viciously, pulli the lifeboat. Rose pulls out a hairpin and jabs him with with a curse and she runs into the crowd. LIGHTOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower away!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose! ROSE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff a sock in it, would ya, Ruth. She'll be along. The boat lurches downward as the falls are paid out. TRACKING WITH ROSE, as she runs through the clusters of p back and a furious Cal is coming after her. She runs brea proper looking men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man tried to take advantage of me in the crowd! Appalled, they turn to see Cal running toward them. Rose men grab Cal, restraining him. She runs throught the Firs Cal breaks free and runs after her. He reaches the entran a knot of people coming out. He pushes rudely through the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal runs in, and down to the landing, pushing past the ge who are filling up the stairs. He scans the A-deck foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hull of Titanic looms over Boat 6 like a cliff. Its e suddenly threatening to those in the tiny boat. Quarterma the tiller, wants nothing but to get away from the ship. two seamen can't row. They flail like a duck with a broke HITCHINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep pulling... away from the ship. Pull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't you boys ever rowed before? Here, gimme those oars. it's done. She climbs over Ruth to get at the oars, stepping on her Around them the evacuation is in full swing, with boats i others being lowered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pulls on the pipe with all his strength. It's not bu gurgling sound. Water pours under the door, spreading rap floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. He tries to pull one hand out of the cuffs, working until raw... no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!! Somebody!! Can anybody hear me?! (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could be bad. 181 THE CORRIDOR outside is deserted. Flooded a couple of Jack's voice comes faintly through the door, but there is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas Andrews is opening stateroom doors, checking that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone in here? Rose runs up to him, breathless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Andrews, thank God! Where would the Master at Arms ta arrest?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You have to get to a boat right away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'll do this with or without your help, sir. But with longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the elevator to the very bottom, go left, down the c then make a right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottom, left, right. I have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose runs up as the last Elecator Operator is closing up OPERATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, miss, lifts are closed-- Without thinking she grabs him and shoves him back into t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm through with being polite, goddamnit!! I may never be of my life! Now take me down!! The operator fumbles to close the gate and start the lift

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and the two seamen are rowing, and they've made it so. Enough to see that the ship is angled down into the w rail less than ten feet above the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on girls, join in, it'll keep ya warm. Let's go Ruth Ruth just stares at the spectacle of the great liner, its blazing, slanting down into the sullen black mirror of th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the wrought iron door of the elevator car Rose ca going past. The lift slows. Suddenly ICE WATER is swirlin She SCREAMS in surprise. So does the operator. The car has landed in a foot of freezing water, shocking her. She claws the door open and splashes out, hiking up skirt so she can move. The lift goes back up, behind her, around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left, crew passage. She spots it and slogs down the flooded corridor. The pla understandably deserted. She is on her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right... right. She turns into a cross-corridor, splashing down the hall. each side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack? Jaaacckk??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is hopelessly pulling on the pipe again, straining u He collapses back on the bench. realizing he's screwed. T through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSE!! In here! 187 IN THE HALL Rose hears his voice behind her. She spin locating the right door, then pushes it open, creating a She splashes over Jack and puts her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Jack, Jack... I'm sorry, I'm so sorry. They are so happy to see each other it's embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy Lovejoy put it in my pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if you can find a key for these. Try those drawers. I one. She kisses his face and hugs him again, then starts to go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... how did you find out I didn't do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. (she looks at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just realized I already knew. They share a look, then she goes back to ransacking the r drawers and cupboards. Jack sees movement out the porthol A LIFEBOAT hits the surface of the water, seen from below

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the seamen detach the falls, Boat One rocks next to and Sir Cosmo Duff-Gordon sit with ten others in a boat m that many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I despise small boats. I just know I'm going to be seasic seasick in small boats. Good Heavens, there's a man down In a lit porthole beneath the surface she sees Jack looki face in a bubble of light under the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stops trashing the room, and stands there, breathing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no key in here. They look around at the water, now almost two feet deep. his feet up onto the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to go for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait here. She runs out, looking back at him once from the doorway, away. Jack looks down at the swirling water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose splashes down the hall to a stairwell going up to th climbs the stairs, her long skirt leaving a trail like a weight of it is really slowing her down. She rips at the shimmies quickly out of the thing. She bounds up the stai stockings and knee-length slip, to find herself in-- 191 A LONG CORRIDOR... part of the labyrinth of steerage She is alone here. A long groan of stressing metal echoes the ship continues to settle. She runs down the hall, uni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Somebody?! She turns a corner and runs along another corridor in a d slopes down into water which, shimmers, reflecting the li the water creeps toward her. A YOUNG MAN appears, running water, sending up geysers of spray. He pelts past her wit eyes crazed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me! We need help! He doesn't look back. It is like a bad dream. The hull go terrifying sounds. The lights flicker and go out, leaving utter darkness. A come back on. She finds herself hyperventilating. That on blackness was the most terrifying of her life. A STEWARD runs around the nearest corner, his arms full o upset to see someone still in his section. He grabs her f arm, pulling her with him like a wayward child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, then, let's get you topside, miss, that's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Wait! I need your help! There's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need for panic, miss. Come along!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, let me go! You're going the wrong way! He's not listening. And he won't let her go. She SHOUTS in his ear, and when he turns, she punches him nose. Shocked, he lets her go and staggers back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Hell with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you there, buster! The steward runs off, holding his bloody nose. She spits the way Jack taugh: her. She turns around, SEES: a glass case with a fire-axe in i glass with a battered suitcase which is lying discarded n the axe, running back the way she came. 192 AT THE STAIRWELL she looks down and gasps. The water bottom five steps. She goes down and has to crouch to loo corridor to the room where Jack is trapped. Rose plunges into the water, which is up to her waist... forward, holding the axe above her head in two hands. She pain from the literally freezing water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack has climbed up on the bench, and is hugging the wate in, holding the axe above her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will this work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find out. They are both terrified, but trying to keep panic at bay. chain connecting the two cuffs, stretching it taut across The chain is of course very short, and his exposed wrists side of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try a couple practice swings. Rose hefts the axe and thunks it into a wooden cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now try to hit the same mark again. She swings hard and the blade thunks in four inches from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's enough practice. He winces, bracing himself as she raises the axe. She has about an inch wide with all the foce she can muster, with either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sounding calm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it, Rose. Hit it as hard as you can, I trust y Jack closes his eyes. So does she. The axe comes down. K-WHANG! Rose gingerly opens her eyes grinning with two separate cuffs. Rose drops the axe, all the strength going out of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work, there, Paul Bunyan. He climbs down into the water next to her. He can't breat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Excuse my French. Ow ow ow, that is cold! Come on, They wade out into the hall. Rose starts toward the stiar Jack stops her. There is only about a foot of the stairwe visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too deep. We gotta find another way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON THE LETTERS TITANIC painted two feet high on the steamer. Once 50 feet above the waterline, they now quiet surface. We see them, gold on black, rippling and dimming as they go deeper. 195 IN BOAT SIX, Ruth looks back at the Titanic, transfix the dying liner. The bowsprit is now barely above the wat Boxhall's rockets EXPLODES overhead. K-BOOM! It lights up and we see half a dozen boats in the water, spreading out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's somethin' you don't see every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The widest passageway in the ship, it is used by crew and and runs almost the length of the ship. Right now steerag along it like refugees, heading aft. CRASH! A wooden doorframe splinters and the door bursts o force of Jack's shoulder. Jack and Rose stumble through, A STEWARD, who was nearby herding people along, marches o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you! You'll have to pay for that, you know. That's W property-- JACK AND ROSE (turning together)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutup! Jack leads her past the dumbfounded steward. They join th stragglers going aft. In places the corridor is almost co by large families carrying all their luggage. AN IRISH WOMAN gives Rose a blanket, more for modesty tha blue-lipped and shivering. IRISHWOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, lass, cover yerself. Jack rubs her arms and tries to warm her up as they walk husband offers them a flask of whiskey. IRISHMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll take the chill off. Rose takes a mighty belt and hands it to Jack. He grins a Jack tries a number of DOORS and IRON GATES along the way locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE BOAT DECK, the action has moved to the aft group o 9, 11, 13 and 15 on the starboard side, and 10, 12, 14 an side. The pace of work is more frantic. You see crew and now to work the davits, their previous complacency gone. CAL pushes through the crowd, scanning for Rose. Around h confusion. A woman is calling for a child who has become crowd. A man is shouting over people's heads. A woman tak Officer Lightoller's arm as he is about to launch Boat 10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you hold the boat a moment? I have to run back to my something-- Lightoller grabs her and shoves her bodily into the boat. rushes up to him just then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are the boats being launched half full?! Lightoller steps past him, helping a seaman clear a snarl LIGHTOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Mr. Andrews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing down at the water)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, look... twenty or so in a boat built for sixty fiv boat with only twelve. Twelve! LIGHTOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... we were not sure of the weight--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubbish! They were tested in Belfast with the weight of 7 these boats, Mr. Lightoller. For God's sake, man! The shot HANDS OFF to Cal, who sees Lovejoy hurrying towa aisle connecting the port and starboard sides of the boat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not on the starboard side either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're running out of time. And this strutting martinet... (indicating Lightoller)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...isn't letting any men in at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one on the other side is letting men in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that's our play. But we're still going to need some (he starts off forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Cal charges off, heading forward, followed by Lovejoy. Th to a finely dressed elderly couple, IDA and ISADOR STRAUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Ida, get into the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We've been together for forty years, and where

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you go, I go. Don't argue with me, Isador, you know it do He looks at her with sadness and great love. They embrace LIGHTOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower away!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE BOW... the place where Jack and Rose first kissed. goes under water water. Water swirls around the captsans the foc'sle deck. Smith strides to the bridge rail and looks down at the we shipped over the sides and the well deck is awash. Two me deck, their feet sending up spray. Behind Smith, Boxhall rocket. WHOOSH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabrizio, standing with Helga Dahl and her family, hears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabrizio! Fabri! Fabrizio turns and sees Jack and Rose pushing through the Jack hug like brothers. FABRIZIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boats are all going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get up there or we're gonna be gargling saltwate Fabrizio points over the heads of the solidly packed crow stairwell. Tommy has his hands on the bars of the steel gate which b the stairwell. The crew open the gate a foot or so and a squeezing through. STEWARD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women only. No men. No men!! But some terrified men, not understanding English, try to gap, forcing the gate open. The crewmen and stewards push shoving and punching them. STEWARD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! Get back you lot! (to the crewmen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock it!! They struggle to get the gate closed again, while Steward small revolver. Another holds a fire axe. They lock the g goes up among the crowd, who surge forward, pounding agai shouting in several languages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the love of God, man, there are children down here! L can have a chance! But the crewmen are scared now. They have let the situati hand, and now they have a mob. Tommy gives up and pushes through the crowd, going down the stairs. He rejoins Jack Fabrizio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hopeless that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whatever we're goin' to do, we better do it fast. Fabrizio turns to Helga, praying he can make himself unde FABRIZIO (with a lot of hand gestures)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone... all of you... come with me now. We go to the the boats. Capito? Come now! They can't understand what he's saying. They can see his DAHL, the patriarch of the family, shakes his head. He wi will not let his family go with this boy. Fabrizio turns FABRIZIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helga... per favore... please... come with me, I am lucky go to America. She kisses him, then steps back to be with her family. Ja his shoulder, his eyes saying "Let's go". FABRIZIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will never forget you. He turns to Jack, who leads the way out of the crowd. Loo sees her face disappear into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLUNK! Cal opens his safe and reaches inside. As Lovejoy out two stacks of bills, still banded by bank wrappers. T "Heart of the Ocean", putting it in the pocket of his ove the safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up stacks of bills)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I make my own luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting the .45 in his waistband)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. Cal grins, putting the money in his pocket as they go out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Rose, Fabrizio and Tommy are lost, searching for a past confused passengers... past a mother changing her ba of an upturned steamer trunk... past a woman arguing heat Serbo-Croatian, a wailing child next to them... past a ma console a woman who is just sitting on the floor, sobbing another man with an English/Arabic dictionary, trying to the signs mean, while his wife and children wait patientl Jack et al come upon a narrow stairwell and they go up tw they are stopped by a small group pressed up against a st steerage men are yelling at a scared STEWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the main stairwell, with everyone else. It'll all g there. Jack takes one look at this scene and finally just loses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it to Hell son of a bitch!! He grabs one end of a bench bolted to the floor on the la pulling on it, and Tommy and Fabrizio pitch in until the breaks free. Rose figures out what they are doing and cle stairs between the waiting people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move aside! Quickly, move aside! Jack and Tommy run up the steps with the bench and RAM IT with all their strength. It rips loose from its track and narrowly mssing the steward. Led by Jack, the crowd surge steps up to the cowering steward and says in her most imp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have any intention of keeping your pathetic job

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the White Star Line, I suggest you escort these good boat deck... now. Class wins out. He nods dumbly motions form them to follo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth rows with Molly Brown, two other women and the incom She rests on her oars, exhausted, and looks back at the s It slants down into the water, still ablaze with light. N water forward of the bridge except for the foremast. Anot off, lighting up the entire area... there are a dozen boa from the ship. 207 AT THE BOAT DECK RAIL Captain Smith is shouting to Bo large metal megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back! Come back to the ship! CHIEF OFFICER WILDE joins him, blowing his silver whistle 208 FROM BOAT 6 the whistle comes shrilly across the wate Hitchins grips the rudder in fear. HITCHINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suction will pull us right down if we don't keep goin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got room for lots more. I say we go back. HITCHINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It's our lives now, not theirs. And I'm in charge of row!! 209 CAPTAIN SMITH, at the rail of the boat deck, lowers h slowly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cal and Lovejoy cross the foyer encounter Benjamin Gug valet, coth dressed in white tie, tail-coats and top hats

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, what's the occasion? GUGGENHEIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have dressed in our best and are prepared to go down l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's admirable, Ben. (walking on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll sure and tell your wife... when I get to New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are still two cardgames in progress. The room is qu A silver serving cart, holding a large humidor, begins to across the room. One of the cardplayers takes a cigar fro by. CARDPLAYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems we've been dealt a bad hand this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal and Lovejoy are walking aft with a purposeful stride. BAKER JOHGHIN, who is working up a sweat tossing deck cha After they go by, Joughin takes a break and pulls a bottl pocket, opening it. He drains it, and tosses it over the stands there a little unteadily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANIC IS SETTING IN around the remaining boats aft. The c mix of all three classes. Officers repeatedly warn men ba The crowd presses in closer. Seamen SCAROTT brandishes the tiller of boat 14 to discou of men who look ready to rush the boat. Several men break forward. Lightoller pulls out his Webley revolver and aims it at t LIGHTOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! Keep order! The men back down. Fifth Officer Lowe standing in the boa crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower away left and right! Lightoller turns away from the crowd and, out of their si pistol open. Letting out a long breath, he starts to LOAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal and Lovejoy arrive in time to see Murdoch lowering hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are still some boats forward. Stay with this one... to be quite... practical. 215 IN THE WATER BELOW there is another panic. Boat 13, a water but still attached to its falls, is pushed aft by t being pumped out of the ship. It winds up directly under coming downt he right on top of it. The passengers shout in panic to the crew above to stop l ignored. Some men put their hands up, trying futilely to boat 15 from crushing them. Fred Barrett, the stoker, gets out his knife and leaps to climbing rudely over people. He cuts the aft falls while cuts the forward lines. 13 drifts out from beneath 15 jus it touches the water with a slap. Cal, looking down from the rail hears GUNSHOTS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifth Officer Lowe, in Boat 14 is firing his gun as a war men threatening to jump into the boat as it passes the op A-Deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back you lot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shots echo away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's starting to fall apart. We don't have much time. Cal sees three dogs run by, including the black French bu released the pets from the kennels. Cal sees Murdoch turn from the davits of boat 15 and star the bow. He catches up and falls in beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Murdoch, I'm a businessman, as you know, and I have a proposition for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Rose et al burst out onto the boat deck from the cr of the third funnel. They look at the empty davits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boats are gone! She sees Colonel Gracie chugging forward along the deck, first class ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel! Are there any boats left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at her bedraggled state)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, miss... there are still a couple of boats all the wa way, I'll lead you! Jack grabs her hand and they sprint past Gracie, with Tom close behind. ANGLE ON THE BAND... incredibly they are still playing. J others run by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music to drown by. Now I know I'm in First Class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water pours like a spillway over the forward railing on B SWEEPS UP past A-Deck to the Boat Deck where Murdoch and loading Collapsible Car the forward-most davits. NOTE: There are four so-called collapsibles, or Engelhard including two which are stored on the roof of the officer The crowd is sparse, with most people still aft. Cal slip hte pocket of his overcoat and into the waist pocket of M greatcoat, leaving the stacks of bills there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we have an understanding then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding curtly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you've said. Cal, satisfied, steps back. He finds himself waiting next Ismay. Ismay does not meet his eyes, nor anyone's. Lovejo at that moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found her. She's just over on the port side. With hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women and children? Any more women and children? (glancing at Cal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any one else, then? Cal looks longingly at his boat... his moment has arrived

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it to hell! Come on. He and Lovejoy head for the port side, taking a short-cut bridge. Bruce Ismay, seeing his oppurtunity, steps quickly into C stares straight ahead, not meeting Murdoch's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at Ismay)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE PORT SIDE Lightoller is getting people into Boat 2 pistol in his hand at this point. Twenty feet below them into the doors and windows of B deck staterooms. They can water cascading into the ship. LIGHTOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women and children, please. Women and children only. Step Even with Jack's arms wrapped around her, Rose is shiveri Near her a WOMAN with TWO YOUNG DAUGHTERS looks into the she knows she may not see again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye for a little while... only for a little while. (to his two little girls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with mummy. The woman stumbles to the boat with the children, hiding them. Beneath the false good cheer, the man is choked wit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold mummy's hand and be a good girl. That's right. Some of the women are stoic, others are overwhelmed by em be helped into the boats. A MAN scribbles a note and hand who is about to board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please get this to my wife in DeMoines, Iowa. Jack looks at Tommy and Fabrizio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better check out the other side. They nod and run off, searching for a way around the deck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the boat, Rose. Cal walks up just then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Get in the boat, Rose. She is shocked to see him. She steps instinctively to Jac her, standing there shivering in her wet slip and stockin display in 1912.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, look at you. (taking off his boat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, put this on. She numbly shrugs into it. He is doing it for modesty, no LIGHTOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly, ladies. Step into the boat. Hurry, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. I'll get the next one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not without you! She doesn't even care that Cal is standing right there. H between Jack and Rose and his jaw clenches. But then he l and says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are boats on the other side that are allowing men i get off safely. Both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he smiles reassuringly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be alright. Hurry up so we can get going... we got o catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in... hurry up, it's almost full. Lightoller grabs her arm and pulls her toward the boat. S Jack and her fingers brush his for a moment. Then she fin stepping down into the boat. It's all a rush and blur. LIGHTOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower away! The two men watch at the rail as the boat begins to desce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost as good as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always win, Jack. One way or another. (looks at him, smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity I didn't keep that drawing. It's going to be worth a morning. Jack knows he is screwed. He looks down at Rose, not want second of his last view of her. 222 ROSE'S PERCEPTION... IN SLOW MOTION: The ropes going pulleys as the seamen start to lower. All sound going awa giving orders, his lips moving... but Rose hears only the her ears... this cannot be happening... a rocket bursts a slow-motion, outlining Jack in a halo of light... Rose's slow motion as she gazes up at him, descending away from his hand trembling, the tears at the corners of his eyes, believe the unbearable pain she is feeling... Rose is still staring up, tears pouring down her face. SUDDENLY SHE IS MOVING. She lunges across the women next the gunwale, climbing it... Hurls herself out of the boat to the rail of the A-Deck p it, and scrambling over the rail. The Boat 2 continues do back on Titanic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
